properties.name: spring.cloud.refresh.enabled
properties.description: Enables autoconfiguration for the refresh scope and associated features.

properties.name: spring.cloud.httpclientfactories.apache.enabled
properties.description: Enables creation of Apache Http Client factory beans.

properties.name: spring.cloud.httpclientfactories.ok.enabled
properties.description: Enables creation of OK Http Client factory beans.

properties.name: spring.cloud.util.enabled
properties.description: Enables creation of Spring Cloud utility beans.

properties.name: spring.cloud.features.enabled
properties.description: Enables the features endpoint.

properties.name: spring.cloud.discovery.enabled
properties.description: Enables discovery client health indicators.

properties.name: spring.cloud.discovery.client.composite-indicator.enabled
properties.description: Enables discovery client composite health indicator.

properties.name: management.endpoint.env.post.enabled
properties.description: Enables writable environment endpoint.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.enabled
properties.description: Enables LoadBalancer retries.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.health-check.initial-delay
properties.description: Initial delay value for the HealthCheck scheduler.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.health-check.interval
properties.description: Interval for rerunning the HealthCheck scheduler.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.health-check.path
properties.description: Path at which the health-check request should be made. Can be set up per `serviceId`. A `default` value can be set up as well. If none is set up, `/actuator/health` will be used.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.health-check.port
properties.description: Path at which the health-check request should be made. If none is set, the port under which the requested service is available at the service instance.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.health-check.refetch-instances
properties.description: Indicates whether the instances should be refetched by the `HealthCheckServiceInstanceListSupplier`. This can be used if the instances can be updated and the underlying delegate does not provide an ongoing flux.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.health-check.refetch-instances-interval
properties.description: Interval for refetching available service instances.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.health-check.repeat-health-check
properties.description: Indicates whether health checks should keep repeating. It might be useful to set it to `false` if periodically refetching the instances, as every refetch will also trigger a healthcheck.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.backoff.enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether Reactor Retry backoffs should be applied.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.backoff.jitter
properties.description: Used to set `RetryBackoffSpec.jitter`.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.backoff.max-backoff
properties.description: Used to set `RetryBackoffSpec.maxBackoff`.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.backoff.min-backoff
properties.description: Used to set `RetryBackoffSpec#minBackoff`.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.max-retries-on-next-service-instance
properties.description: Number of retries to be executed on the next `ServiceInstance`. A `ServiceInstance` is chosen before each retry call.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.max-retries-on-same-service-instance
properties.description: Number of retries to be executed on the same `ServiceInstance`.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.retry-on-all-operations
properties.description: Indicates retries should be attempted on operations other than `HttpMethod.GET`}.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.retry.retryable-status-codes
properties.description: A `Set` of status codes that should trigger a retry.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.sticky-session.add-service-instance-cookie
properties.description: Indicates whether a cookie with the newly selected instance should be added by LoadBalancer.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.sticky-session.instance-id-cookie-name
properties.description: The name of the cookie holding the preferred instance id.

properties.name: spring.cloud.loadbalancer.x-forwarded.enabled
properties.description: To Enable X-Forwarded Headers.
